reviews.sentence: Great staff. Were friendly and helpful. First in English I did not stay in The Corktown Hotel yet. I´m going on May of 2015But when I sent an e mail asking for the rate of the room and other details was promptly answered by Suzete Daye that showed me the new mentality of the hotel by being clear about the services they provide saying what the improvements is going on and giving me instructions about the surroundings and how to get to Comerica Park. This attitude and transparency for sure were crucial to the decision I´ve made on staying at The Corktown Hotel. After my stay I will return with comments about the hotel itself. Stay tunedAgora em Português. Eu ainda não fiquei no The Corktown Hotel. Eu ficarei em Maio de 2015Mas quando eu enviei um e mail para saber o valor da diária e outros detalhes. fui prontamente atendido pela Suzete Daye que me mostrou a nova mentalidade do hotel sendo clara sobre os serviços que eles oferecem dizendo os melhoramentos que estão acontecendo e me dando instruções sobre as redondezas e como chegar até o Comerica Park. Esa atitude e transparência sem dúvida foram decisivos para que eu me decidise em ficar no The Corktown Hotel. Depois da minha estadia eu volto com comentários sobre o hotel em si. Fiquem ligados.

Great customer service impressive renovations. We stayed just one night but wish we could have stayed longer. This hotel is under new management and undergoing renovations. Our room was a bit outdated but clean. You can tell there has been a lot of effort by the new team to change the look and atmosphere of the hotel. We had an issue with the plumbing in our room and were floored by the effort management took to amend things for us. We were fortunate enough to be able to be moved to one of their new concept rooms. It was absolutely gorgeous. I ca nt say enough about it. It had a cool modern industrial look and amazing details. I also love that all the rooms are set back from the hallway cutting out traffic noise from the hall. The staff were very friendly and helpful and went over an above to make our stay a great experience. I ca nt wait to come back and see the renovations completed.

Pleasantly surprised. Was hesitant on staying here while in town for a Tigers game but had a good experience. Yes its outdated but they are working on updating the hotel as a whole. Would definitely stay here again. can not beat the price location.

I wo nt go back ever again. We used to get the rooms for a reasonable rate. Now they want double for THE SAME ROOM. In addition there has been no repairs to the outside of the motel. The elevator needs to updated badly. we got stuck between the floors. My experience with corktown this time was by far the worst. I was expecting much better for what i paid. I understand that theneighborhod is rehabing but you have not done enough to your hotel to charge that much.

Horrible Experience Would not Recommend. The site advertises beautiful rooms however when we arrived the first room we were given room 401. the rug was filthy the room was old and to top that all off there was a huge cockroach still alive and kicking under the sink. Seeing as we paid 160 plus tax Canadian for our room on the weekend of August 22 I was not expecting such a filthy place. I called the front desk from the room and indicated that we could not stay here because I can not do cockroaches. The girl was not surprised and offered us an upgrade. As there was no hotels available in Detroit because of many events being held I had two choices to sleep in my truck or to take the upgrade. We took the up grade room 304 which was not much of an upgrade at all. Yes it had a hotub which I was scared to use the boxspring looked like it had been in the dumpster the window sills had cigarette ashes on them and the walls around the A C was buckling and cracking. This hotel should not be using these rooms if they are renovating and advertising the new rooms. The hallways smelled mouldy and there was bullet proof glass encasing the receptionists.

Clean rooms great mirror over the sink. We were going to be in Detroit on a night when the Tigers were at home and there were 2 concerts occurring. Every hotel we had stayed at previously was booked after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor thanks to everyone by the way we decided to give The Corktown Hotel a try reserved a remodeled room. The rooms are not large but feel spacious there was plenty of room for the 2 of us. The renovated rooms contain a bed a lounge chair a desk two metal chairs as well as a fabric shelf that would hold clothes. The sink is open to the room separate from the toilet shower. There is not a refrigerator or a microwave although there is a microwave near the lobby by the coffee tea and pop snack machines. They have a pop machine that costs 75 10 which is a great deal compared to other hotels costs of 250. The price may be based on the fact that the pop is not cold but there is an ice machine right there glasses are in your room. The hotel does have a laundry room which is where you will find an iron an ironing board. The renovated rooms do not have a telephone but in this era of cell phones it likely will not matter to most. WiFi is free and it works. we had asked the two clerks on duty the directions to walk to Ford Field neither had any idea. We discovered to just walk left down Trumbull to Michigan and turn right. it is probably a little more than a mile to Comerica Park and Ford Field it was an easy walk in the afternoon. there is not a lot around the Corktown Hotel right now so I had advise taking a taxi if you are returning after dark. Coffee tea are available in the morning it would be extremely helpful if lids were available for the styrofoam glasses. The renovated rooms are very well done the others are absolutely dated but appeared to be clean. There certainly is not a welcoming atmosphere when arriving others had mentioned the bulletproof glass it definitely is there. When you check in you must use a buzzer to gain access to the lobby after that you use your room card. While it will not alleviate the bulletproof glass some concern with needing to be buzzed in some pots of flowers outside inside would help the ambience so to speak. The locked parking area is free. Oh yes the mirror. I do not know what kind of lights are in that mirror but the result is astonishing a lot of my wrinkles simply did not appear. I am going to have to find out what lighting they use make a hat with a battery operated light shining in my face. If for no other reason stay here because of the mirror.

Perfect for the budget traveller who wish to stay close to downtown. The hotel is in an ok location if you are willing to walk ten or fifteen minutes to fowntown. The hotel is certinatly not the hilton but offers value for money for travelers checking out Detroit. Overall I had a positive experiance at the hotel however was nt keen on the glass partiction at the reception although I understand Detriot has had its fair share of problems recently. The rooms and decor in general could do with a lick of paint also.

a dive. avoid. This is a dive. do not let the hip location and exterior fool you. it is an old motel with dirty worn carpets stained light fittings battered furniture old dilapidated bathrooms. I have stayed in some second rate places but this is third world quality. The close in location does not make up for it.

Excellent. Service was fantastic place was clean the price was right. Areas for improvement vending machines did not cool drinks lack of ice machines no hotel store lacking in amenities but an overall good experience.

Just sleeping good place. Staying longer well after remodel will be good. Staff was excellent. Things will be better once the remodel is complete. The oldness of the rooms but they are in process of remodel and will be real nice once it is completed.

Great Renovations. Great new addition to the Detroit hotel scene. Very friendly staff. it is on the fridge of downtown in Corktown with ample and secure parking and easy access to the most vibrant areas of the city. The renovations are so cool The rooms are modern amenities plenty and beds comfy. I love the refurbished industrial feel to the rooms and common areas. I can not wait to see the place after the first two floors and rear elevator are completed. I will definitely be back.

Hip and Upcoming Hotel. My experience with this hotel was more than outstanding. Staff was so nice. I asked for an early check in was advised of places to go till a room was ready then called when my room was available. These room are so cute and homey. Reminded me of a studio apartment. Once completely finished this hotel will be amazing. I will simply come back to Detroit just to see where this hotel is at in a year. Not much to do directly surrounding the hotel. Brewery across the street. Short drive to Michigan Ave to find other restaurants.
Management and staff at the Detroit Trumbull and Porter Hotel is a really neat hotel. Has a very cool modern minimalist vibe going on. The management and staff are attentive and professional.

With mixed feelings Trumbull and Porter tries to punch above its weight — but fails. I liked that the owners invested in creating a boutique ish ambience inspired by Ace hotels and their ilk. industrial chic meets mid century furniture meets minimalism. By and large it worked for me and I enjoyed the place. I was also happy with their friendly and helpful staff shout out to John. that provided me with directions and recommendations. So far so good. However Trumbull and Porter failed to provide a good nights sleep. I was unfortunate to have a neighbor that cranked up the TV only to fall asleep snoring. This was when the facade broke down and it became evident that the place used to be a motel with paper thin walls — and that at its core it still is that cheap motel. The night clerk was not solution oriented either and I had to prod him three times until he agreed to move me to a new room at 1 am his attempts to contact the snoring neighbor had failedBotom line Trumbull and Porter tries to create something different and I give it credit for that. If you are a light sleeper however your sleep quality is not guaranteed and you might want to consider staying at another place.

Nice vibe not in the thick of it. Hip renovated modern feel hotel 5 minutes drive away from sports concert area downtown and museums. Easy drive too. Rooms are basic but fine only downside pillows were flat and lumpy beds are full not queens. Coffee cafe and restaurant staff on sight were friendly and there was a good vibe. It is in a coming up area not bad just not lots around. There was s brewery across street we could see may have been more.
Stayed here for a concert at th Masonic. Got the job done. Clean and friendly. Nice laid back vibe.

Hip and comfortable hotel near Corktown. I had a great stay at the Trumbull and Porter this past weekend. The staff was very nice and accommodating and the hotel itself has a hip vibe. The rooms are very fresh and stylish looking and even come with robes. Plus the bed was super comfortable. The location is right next to Corktown which has a lot of fun bars. And it ’s only a short drive to downtown. I would definitely stay here again.

Love this modern boutique hotel. We stayed the night for an event in downtown Detroit a quick five minute Uber ride away and now I am looking for excuses to come to Detroit so we can stay at Trumbull and Porter. The styling furniture and atmosphere of the hotel is wonderful and modern. I found the bed comfortable and the exposed concrete floors and remodeled building reminded me of other boutique hotels in the area but this place is half the cost with all the atmosphere. The bathroom is not huge but I will gladly sacrifice that in favor of the afordability TP offers. We grabbed a quick drink and some appetizers before going to our event and my only regret was not having dinner too. The drinks were inventive and tasty and the food was outstanding.

I traveled alone for business. Staff was friendly and accommodating. My room was clean. My bed was comfortable. I appreciate having a minifridge in the room to keep drinks in. I like the on trend decor very Scandinavian. I felt like I was sleeping in an IKEA. The outdoor area was nice as was having a bar restaurant and little coffee bar in house. Prior to booking I had read a review that said there were unspecified bugs so I literally checked the mattress for bed bugs usually in the cracks and signs would be dark brown spots from excreted blood and found no indication of bugs whatsoever. I did not see a single insect of any kind inside the hotel during my three day stay. The only confirmed con would be that my room did smell a little musty. The buildings bones are a little older so its not pristine. Overall my experience was very good I had say this is a nice hotel. If you like a little character this is the place. If you want typical boring sleeping accommodations then keep searching.

We love the Motor City Casino the music and the ambience. the whole city and its history is there. Beautiful renovation. Comfortable bed. Good food. Great value. Internet was not working. Its an IP issue.
